WorkItem.ClosedComment:
This appears to have been a user mistake in entering the code, as explained in the comment:

The markup you've got in your Browse.aspx page should be in the Index.aspx page instead. The StoreBrowseViewModel doesn't have a list of Genres, since the Browse page shows a list of Albums in one Genre.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi Mate

I am working on the MvcMusicStore Tutorial, i want to browse the list of each genre so that i can see the details, but always get the following error

Error	1	'MvcMusicStore.ViewModels.StoreBrowseViewModel' does not contain a definition for 'Genres' and no extension method 'Genres' accepting a first argument of type 'MvcMusicStore.ViewModels.StoreBrowseViewModel' could be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)	

i have applied the USING directive as it has been illustrated on the tutorial, but still getting error.

I have attached the Browse page so that you can see the error
WorkItem.Summary: Problem on how to Browse the List of Genre (Mvc Music Store Tutorial)

Comments.Message:
The markup you've got in your Browse.aspx page should be in the Index.aspx page instead. The StoreBrowseViewModel doesn't have a list of Genres, since the Browse page shows a list of Albums in one Genre.

Can you let me know which page of the tutorial you're on?
